result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Alan Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney Alan Sutton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodney Alan Sutton was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days county jail with huber (time served)

judgments.dispoDesc:
DEF pleads NC to CT#2 found guilty, Dismiss CT#1
Court sentences DEF on CT#2 to 30 days county jail  with huber credit for 47 days (time served)  costs $443.00  apply $350 bond balance due today

Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in court via video means with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  State agrees to lower bond to $350 cash---court orders bond be reduced from $1,000 cash to $350 cash bond, conditions to remain in effect.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Count 2 on behalf of DE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Jarvis has a conflict, requests to adjourn to allow Public Defender's office to appoint alternative counsel.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Bruce Poquette appeared in person.  Attorney Martin Jarvis appeared in person for DE.  DE appeared via video means, in custody.

State waives right to 5 day notice.  Court DENIED motion for bond modification.
